communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear NC ISAAC,

I am submitting a public records request under North Carolina General Statutes (NCGS) § 132-1 for any intelligence bulletins, threat assessments, situational awareness reports, or law enforcement notifications issued by NC ISAAC between February 21, 2025, and February 28, 2025.

Specifically, I request:
	1.	Any general or region-specific intelligence reports issued during this period.
	2.	Any alerts or warnings shared with local law enforcement agencies related to public safety concerns.
	3.	Any internal memos or communications summarizing relevant intelligence within this timeframe.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide the specific statutory exemption under which the information is being withheld. Additionally, if redactions are required, I request that you provide the non-exempt portions of the records in accordance with state law.

Please confirm receipt of this request at your earliest convenience and provide an estimated timeline for fulfillment. If any fees are associated with processing, I would appreciate a cost estimate before proceeding.

Thank you for your time and cooperation. I look forward to your response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alabama Times

title: FBI support for 2022 A&E documentary series "Butchers of the Bayou"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI support for 2022 A&E documentary series "Butchers of the Bayou"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to FBI support for or collaboration with the production of the 2022 A&E documentary series "Butchers of the Bayou." Such documents may include, but are not limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the FBI and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Butchers of the Bayou," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication. I request a search of all locations where such documents might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ or similar offices.

Attached is a document, released to me by the FBI in response to a previous FOIA request, confirming that the FBI supported the production of "Butchers of the Bayou."

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo
